channel.title: Open Source Project Work on jwoolbright.com
channel.description: Recent content in Open Source Project Work on jwoolbright.com

item.title: Starter Pack
item.description: Description Learners that graduate from our programs are often encouraged to contribute to open source projects so further develop their professional experience and skills. We thought that it may be helpful if a walkthrough was provided that gives a better idea of what that general workflow is in order to contribute to an existing project. Steps included in walkthrough: Forking an existing repository File structure explanation Cloning forked repository Creating a new branch Making changes and staging Push local changes to forked remote repo Submitting pull request The Github repository for this project can be located here:

item.title: Collab Blog
item.description: Description After completing the walkthrough for the Open Source Starter Pack project learners are encouraged to begin contributing to the Collab-Blog project that we created. This project was designed to include issues for beginners and intermediate skill levels so that all can contribute. Technologies Included in Project: Java with Spring Boot Angular framework incorporating Java API as a service MySQL Database to store blog data The Github repository for this project can be located here:
